example.text: This data is key to helping all ocean stakeholders work together to effectively address threats to marine life without placing regulatory burdens on the shoulders of a single industry. Read more about the letter here .

I'm happy to announce that three departments, one in the North Lakes fire district, one serving Littleton, and one serving Mapleton, Castle Hill, and Chapman, have been awarded a total of $273,199.99 grants through the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) Assistance to Firefighters Grants (AFG) program. Dwight Cowperthwaite of the Littleton Fire Department told me that they are "pleased to have the grant," and that theirs "is being used to replace aged SCBA (self-contained breathing apparatus), which has been greatly needed in the last few years."

SAM has been a key partner in my focus on protecting Maine's outdoors and the time-honored traditions that take place in it. It was great to hear from those present about the work SAM is doing to protect Maine's wildlife and advocate for the interests of our state's sportsmen.

Leading the Bipartisan Push for Additional Support for Ukraine The timely delivery of American fighter jets to soldiers in Ukraine is not only a critical strategic investment in Kiev's military capabilities, but also a push to bring this conflict to a just conclusion. I'm proud to lead a bipartisan group of 15 of my colleagues in pushing President Biden to provide F-16 Fighting Falcon aircraft or similar fourth-generation aircraft, to the fighters in Kiev as soon as possible I was happy to have a guest spot on NBC's Meet The Press last week to talk about our effort to support Ukraine.

The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) is responsible for collecting information on strandings and must compile and analyze the conditions and causes of illnesses and deaths of these stranded whales. This information is used to inform the action regulators take to protect marine mammals, including levying regulations on industries like Maine's lobster fishery.
